articles.title: Apple puts Vision Pro exec in charge of Siri in exec shakeup - TechCrunch

articles.title: Scientists Reveal Why We Can’t Remember Our Earliest Years - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A new fMRI study reveals that babies as young as 12 months can encode memories, contradicting theories that memory formation is impossible in infancy. Instead, the inability to recall early life may stem from retrieval failures rather than memory loss. Challe…
articles.content:
For years, scientists have puzzled over why we can’t remember our earliest years. A groundbreaking fMRI study now suggests that infant memories are formed but become inaccessible later in life.
